author: Staff Reporter
text: A case was filed against M.V.S. Rajendranath, a speaker of Desiya Murpokku Dravida Kazhagam (DMDK) and cine actor, on the a charge of urging voters to accept money for votes if any party offered them. According to a statement from Thoothukudi Sub-Collector and Returning Officer S. Gopala Sundara Raj, the speaker was speaking at a public meeting organised by the DMDK near Chidambara Nagar bus stop on March 26. Based on the video recording of a surveillance team deputed on poll duty, it was found in violation of model code of conduct. Thoothukudi South Police have filed a case against him.
title: Case against DMDK speaker
